chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J Peterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction (Sentence Imposed & Stayed, Probation Ordered) from Dunn County case 15CF9. (This case was dismissed and read in for restitution)

Dunn County Case 15CF9: copy of minutes: Read In Pierce County #15CF122 for $358.38 restitution and dismiss, Copy for Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, and copy of Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI)

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Court reads charge and maximum penalties.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court.    Pretrial Conference to be set.    The bond will continue as ordered.  Court reviews bond conditions with defendant.  O'Sullivan moves to modify bond to $100 cash bond.  O'Sullivan withdraws request for bond modification.

10:17 a.m.  Defendant Anthony J Peterson in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant Anthony J Peterson in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan calls Investigator Collin Gilles.  Gilles is sworn and takes the stand.  O'Sullivan examines Gilles.  Gilles identifies defendant.  Bub cross examines Gilles.  O'Sullivan does recross.  Bub gives argument.  O'Sullivan gives argument.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 11:46  a.m.  Defendant Anthony J Peterson in court.  Christopher Bub appearing in court with defendant.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and maximum penalties.    Defendant waives reading of the complaint.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Thorie:  Requests $3000.00 signature bond and no contact with Matthew Holcombe and comply with fingerprints and photograph.  Bub has no objections.  Court grants Thorie's request.  Need to set for preliminary hearing.  State withdraws request for warrant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

10:40 Defendant Anthony J Peterson not in court.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: requests bench warrant. Clerks office received a call he would be a little late. Court will sign upon presentation.
